title: All / Every / Each
content: [Every|All] student has a book. [All|Every] students have books.
explanationEnUs: 'Every' is used with singular nouns. 'All' is used with plural nouns.
explanationZhTw: 'Every' 用於單數名詞。'All' 用於複數名詞。
explanationZhCn: 'Every' 用于单数名词。'All' 用于复数名词。

title: Both / Either / Neither
content: [Both|Either] of my parents are teachers. [Neither|Either] of them is strict.
explanationEnUs: 'Both' refers to two things. 'Neither' means not one and not the other.
explanationZhTw: 'Both' 指兩件事。'Neither' 意指兩者皆非。
explanationZhCn: 'Both' 指两件事。'Neither' 意指两者皆非。

title: No / None
content: There is [no|none] water left. [None|No] of the answers are correct.
explanationEnUs: Use 'no' before a noun. Use 'none' without a following noun or with 'of'.
explanationZhTw: 'No' 用在名詞前。'None' 不接名詞或與 'of' 連用。
explanationZhCn: 'No' 用在名词前。'None' 不接名词 or 与 'of' 连用。

title: This / That / These / Those (Determiners)
content: [This|These] book is mine. [Those|That] shoes are yours.
explanationEnUs: These determiners must agree in number with the noun they modify.
explanationZhTw: 這些限定詞在數上必須與其修飾的名詞一致。
explanationZhCn: 这些限定词在数上必须与其修饰的名词一致。

title: Quantifiers
content: I have [some|any] money. Do you have [any|some] questions?
explanationEnUs: 'Some' is usually for positive sentences. 'Any' is for questions and negatives.
explanationZhTw: 'Some' 通常用於肯定句。'Any' 用於疑問句和否定句。
explanationZhCn: 'Some' 通常用于肯定句。'Any' 用于疑问句和否定句。
